alert.note: Alert for Big Stone; Traverse (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 18 at 10:19AM CDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS POSSIBLE INTO THIS AFTERNOON FROM BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW... Gusty northwest winds will continue into the afternoon hours today leading to blowing and drifting snow. The combination of the wind and blowing snow will reduce visibilities, especially in unsheltered areas and in open country. These conditions will also lead to icy conditions on roads as the snow melts and re-freezes. Motorists should be aware of the potentially quickly changing conditions and should drive accordingly. Winds will subside by late afternoon with improving conditions expected by this evening. Unfortunately, another round of strong winds are expected to develop across the downslope favored areas of the Prairie Coteau late tonight into Sunday. This will lead to more blowing and drifting snow, reduced visibilities and hazardous travel conditions.
